text: hey guys it's Elise today I'm here to
show you guys a really really simple but
really effective little Christmas sweet
treat idea we're going to be making no
big Christmas trees in a little forest
using Kit Kats super simple super
effective and great to serve up at all
of your parties before Christmas let's
get started today's tools and
ingredients include some Kit Kats and I
recommend the family size blocks some
melted green candy melts and a ziplock
bag you're going to need a knife a pair
of scissors and a spoon I've got some
assorted sprinkles down here so I've got
some little stars some little sequins or
confetti sprinkles and some little tiny
candy canes and I've also got just a
little bit of baking paper or grease
proof paper now the first thing you want
to do is for each four fingers of Kit
Kat you're going to get three trees so
you want to take just a sharp knife and
you can see I'm just cutting with one
smooth clean sharp cut I started off
with the fore-finger Kit Kats here but I
actually found that the family blocks of
Kit Kat were a lot stronger and have
slightly thicker chocolate so the tops
of the trees didn't break as often use
the scraps now and just cut out three
sort of little trunk type shapes for the
bottoms of your little Christmas trees
and then you want to dip the tops of the
trunks into some of that green candy
melt and use that like a glue to kind of
stick on to the bottom of your little
Kit Kat Christmas trees once they're all
stuck you want to take your green candy
melt and just tip it into a ziplock bag
this is going to act like a bit of a
piping bag so squeeze it all the way
down to the corner and cut off a
relatively fine tip on the end which
will make like a nice fine little piping
tip starting about a centimeter on
either side of the Christmas tree you
just want to quickly squiggle some of
that green candy melt back and forth to
give your tree some texture and then
while that's still wet you can take one
of your little stars and stick it
straight down on the very top for the
star atop your Christmas tree acting
quite quickly here because you need that
candy melt to be wet sprinkle on some of
those little confetti sprinkles to make
your lights and then down go I just put
like three
there's a little candy cane sprinkles
that's basically how you make your no
baked Christmas trees I told you these
we're going to be really simple
before that dries you want to use your
knife just to slip underneath the
Christmas tree and pick it up to make
sure that you're leaving that excess
candy melt from either side of the tree
behind and you have a really nice neat
finish on the sides of your trees so
those are ready to go either as treats
cupcake toppers or cake decorations but
if you want to take them over the top a
little bit grab yourself a serving tray
some desiccated coconut and some melted
white chocolate and I'm going to show
you how to turn these into a little
edible Christmas tree forest grabbing a
sharp knife just trim the very very
bottom off your Christmas tree so you've
got a really nice flat base to your
Christmas tree trunks and then you just
want to take your fully set Christmas
trees dip them in a little bit of that
melted white chocolate to act as a bit
of a glue and pop them straight down
onto your display plate now once you've
got all of your little Christmas trees
standing up in place all stuck to that
display plate you can add some other
decorations like some little chocolate
Santa's or some little snowmen finish it
off with a sprinkle of your coconut snow
and that completes your gorgeous
miniature Christmas tree forest this is
fabulous as a Christmas snack a
Christmas tree a table centerpiece and
the best part is your guests can just go
up snap off one of the trees and wander
around munching on them if you guys take
these at home I would love it if you'd
share them on the my cupcake addiction
Instagram make sure that you don't
forget about all of my previous year's
Christmas tutorials I have a ton of
great ideas for the festive season I'll
leave a link to the Christmas playlist
in the description box below and as
always thanks very much for watching
